page.title: 01THE AREA OF NORTH YATE
page.content: The rectangle of land which we are calling "North Yate" is about ten miles north-east of Bristol.It consists largely of fields and farmland.The south-western corner includes some of the village of Iron Acton,and the northern part takes in part of Rangeworthy.In the south- eastern part there are new housing developments.Running from south to north through the centre of the rectangle is the mainly residential North Road,and there are houses dotted around in the country lanes.The land is fairly flat and featureless. Although it is a country area,with schools,pubs,and shops sharing the role as centres of village life,it is impossible to ignore the proximity of the town of Yate.Yate has a population of 30,000,the majority of whom live in houses built in the last decade or so.
